name: deemed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
deem
C2 to consider or judge something in a particular way: [ + obj + noun/adj ] The area has now been deemed safe. [ + noun/adj ] We will provide help whenever you deem it appropriate. [ + obj + to infinitive ] Anyone not paying the registration fee by 31 March will be deemed to have withdrawn from the offer. Synonym
hold
More examplesFewer examplesThe story was deemed too controversial and so they spiked it.She is currently deemed to be the best British athlete.This survey is deemed to be a reliable barometer of public opinion.Safflower oil is low in the sort of fats that are deemed to be bad for people's health.It is deemed bad manners in some cultures to speak with your mouth full of food.
